svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - November 27 2016

title: "Week in Ethereum News
November 27, 2016" date: "2016-11-27"
News and Links
Top
• The Spurious Dragon hard fork went off without a hitch at first. But then it didn’t at block
2686351, when the two main clients disagreed with each other on a rather trivial issue. Consensus
lost, unintentional fork. Why? The spam clearing account (eg old or current ) ran out of Ether, so the
Geth client deleted the spam but the Parity client did not. Either would be correct, but both clients
must do the same thing. There was some snarking between the dev teams on Twitter but the Yellow Paper
spec was ambiguous. [The Yellow Paper is quite dense and a reference version might be useful] In the
end, Geth updated with a fix in a mere ~10 hours. Transactions weren’t lost – the losers are the Geth
miners on the abandoned chain. Lessons will be learned and processes will be improved
The Spurious Dragon hard fork went off without a hitch at first. But then it didn’t at block 2686351,
when the two main clients disagreed with each other on a rather trivial issue. Consensus lost,
unintentional fork.
• Why? The spam clearing account (eg old or current ) ran out of Ether, so the Geth client deleted the
spam but the Parity client did not. Either would be correct, but both clients must do the same thing.
Why? The spam clearing account (eg old or current ) ran out of Ether, so the Geth client deleted the
• There was some snarking between the dev teams on Twitter but the Yellow Paper spec was ambiguous.
[The Yellow Paper is quite dense and a reference version might be useful]
There was some snarking between the dev teams on Twitter but the Yellow Paper spec was ambiguous.
• In the end, Geth updated with a fix in a mere ~10 hours. Transactions weren’t lost – the losers are
the Geth miners on the abandoned chain.
In the end, Geth updated with a fix in a mere ~10 hours. Transactions weren’t lost – the losers are
• Lessons will be learned and processes will be improved
Lessons will be learned and processes will be improved
• Vitalik’s FAQ on cleaning the state of spam . It will take another week (or slightly longer ) to
finish.
Vitalik’s FAQ on cleaning the state of spam . It will take another week (or slightly longer ) to
• The develop version of Parity also set the default gas price to zero, so there was a brief kerfuffle
, but miners realized and fixed it.
The develop version of Parity also set the default gas price to zero, so there was a brief kerfuffle
• Alex van de Sande on progress made towards the Metropolis milestone release .
Alex van de Sande on progress made towards the Metropolis milestone release .
Tech
• Raiden Network PoC 1 released
Raiden Network PoC 1 released
• Solidity v0.4.6 released Browser-Solidity now features some static analysisa
Solidity v0.4.6 released
• Browser-Solidity now features some static analysisa
• Go Ethereum library at Maven Central (Android) and CocoaPods (iOS)

• Parity 1.4.5 released – now with a non-zero default for the –usd-per-tx flag
Parity 1.4.5 released – now with a non-zero default for the –usd-per-tx flag
• Geth 1.5.3 released
Geth 1.5.3 released
Ecosystem
• Ethereum Name Service launches on Ropsten testnet – (test) register your domain name today
• A large MyEtherWallet.com Update
• More DevCon2 videos released this week- web3, Swarm, EVM, Raiden, etc
• 8 videos from DappHack Berlin
• Blockchain Energy Trading interview Consensys and Siemens will “jointly develop microgrids that
enable local energy trading based on blockchain technology”
• Consensys and Siemens will “jointly develop microgrids that enable local energy trading based on
blockchain technology”

my token sale thoughts

• Charlie Shrem is starting a private equity fund and making ownership an Ethereum token. Token sale
to follow.

follow.
General
• Melon founders did a video interview on Melon/Polkadot
Melon founders did a video interview on Melon/Polkadot

A bunch of banks left R3
• JPMorgan’s Quorum is on Github - their implementation of Ethereum worked on by Jeff Wilcke (and
others )

• Aaron Watson interviews Joe Lubin

• SWIFT unveils PoC – Eris Tendermint with Solidy contracts
SWIFT unveils PoC – Eris Tendermint with Solidy contracts
• Two good reads on passwords – I’m not doing them justice with this description: Taylor Van Orden on
what’s in your keystore Thomas Clowes with a practical read on how he robbed himself - lots of links
for future reference.
Two good reads on passwords – I’m not doing them justice with this description:
• Taylor Van Orden on what’s in your keystore
Taylor Van Orden on what’s in your keystore
• Thomas Clowes with a practical read on how he robbed himself - lots of links for future reference.

• Kraken on how 2FA with SMS messaging is useless if someone wants to hack you.

• Could Bitcoin do smart contracts? Not really .
Could Bitcoin do smart contracts? Not really .
• Vitalik offered some technical advice to Ethereum Classic and Charles Hoskinson got irritable.
(Thread bonus: a Taylor Van Orden response [and context ] - her Reddit comments make me laugh the
hardest)
Vitalik offered some technical advice to Ethereum Classic and Charles Hoskinson got irritable.
Dates of Note
• Nov 25 - 27 – Canadian regulator hackathon
Nov 25 - 27 – Canadian regulator hackathon
• Nov 28 – BlockCDN crowdsale begins
Nov 28 – BlockCDN crowdsale begins
• Nov 29 – Arcade.City crowdsale ends
Nov 29 – Arcade.City crowdsale ends
• Dec 4 – Next ether.camp price change
Dec 4 – Next ether.camp price change
• Dec 15 – vDice crowdsale ends
Dec 15 – vDice crowdsale ends
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as to even whether
they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether any will produce a satisfactory
return. This is not investment advice.]
Misapplied Bitcoin Mindsets
This week saw plenty of misapplied Bitcoin mindsets in the Ethereum community.
Every time we have a bump in the road (like we had this week), there are a minority of folks in the
Ethereum community who freak out. What about network effects? OMG price matters ! Both sentiments
got significant upvotes on Reddit this week.
Bitcoin’s network effects are monetary – whether people use Bitcoin as a store of value and/or payment
method. Price isn’t just important, it’s arguably the only thing. That’s what matters in Bitcoin,
but not in Ethereum.
Ethereum’s network effects are dapps – are developers building decentralized software on Ethereum?
So the important question is always the same: are we closer to successful working dapps?
1000 subscribers?
I set a goal of getting to 1000 subscribers by the end of the year. Currently, we’re at 650.
If this issue was useful to you, would you share it on social media or email it to a friend? I hate
it when I don’t achieve goals.
Just in case you want to send me Ether: 0x96d4F0E75ae86e4c46cD8e9D4AE2F2309bD6Ec45
